column11: I'd remove one point from all my answers if I had to do any of these things by myself. It's more fun with another designer.
column38: Jordana Mello (Agile Six), Kev Walsh (Product Manager) or Jacqueline Gu

column11: Related to discovery: content auditing, heuristic evals = 4/5ish.
column12: I have an outdated Google Analytics cert, I have some interest in GA but it's not something I want to "do". It would be great to have someone on the team (or at CA) who could be our go-to person for that.
column20: Assuming "Interface/UI design" is the visual layer, not the UX design/wires. Where I said "4" for design system, I mean in terms of partnering w/ a visual designer to define and implement a system. And for "Designing for accessibility", similarly it's more around ensuring our design system adheres to accessibility best practices, and less around actually making the necessary updates. "Product design" feels broad, so I marked that as "like" with the understanding that I am not a visual designer but come at it from a content perspective.
column26: Prototyping is an "I'd like to learn more"-type of area for me.
column33: As noted earlier - the "Discovery" phase, content auditing and readouts.
column34: "Content Strategy" is very broad, and IMO overlaps with much of the "design strategy" items in the beginning of this form. But I really love working with clients to understand how they work and create content, and how they can improve their processes and redefine the content they create.

column12: My interest in interviewing users and stakeholders is a 2/5, but my interest in interviewing candidates for CA roles is a 4/5.
column26: I love this area, too! B)
column34: I would say that I'm least experienced in this area, so I don't have as formed of an opinion here. If I had a choice, I would prefer to focus my time and energy in growing elsewhere (visual design & interaction design). Accessibility in general though is important to me, which is why I rated it as a 3/5 here.

column20: I probably score high in VX but I'm not too interested in doing more of it. Also, I'm not sure if product design counts as VX... product is all-encompassing imo.
